itemDescription: British swimmer, Olympic silver medallist, former world record-holder, Cunard celebrity crew member

wikipedia_page.main: Hilda Marjorie James (27 April 1904 – 27 July 1982) was a British competitive swimmer who competed at the 1920 Summer Olympics.  James won a silver medal in the women's 4×100-metre freestyle relay and swam in semifinals of the 300-metre freestyle event. She held seven world records and 29 English records.
